episodes.title: Why Do MAGA Catholics HATE Pope Francis So Much???
episodes.description:
In this episode, Shannon Vavich engages with Mark Shea to explore the complex relationship between MAGA Catholics and Pope Francis. They discuss the historical context of the pro-life movement, the concept of heresy within Catholicism, and the implications of nationalism and tribalism in faith. The conversation delves into how political agendas have shaped Catholic beliefs and practices, particularly regarding abortion and social justice. Shea emphasizes the need for a holistic understanding of Catholic teaching that transcends partisan divides, advocating for a faith that prioritizes the dignity of all human life. In this conversation, Shannon Vavich and Mark Shea explore the complexities of contemporary Christianity, particularly in relation to the MAGA movement, the pro-life stance, and the broader implications of legalism and cruelty in society. They discuss the absurdity of imposing law as a means of salvation, the mystery of evil, and the dangers of a culture that promotes scarcity and fear. The dialogue emphasizes the importance of empathy, the need to address victims of cruelty, and the role of laypeople in evangelism. Ultimately, they highlight the revolutionary force of Christianity and the hope that persists amidst historical challenges, advocating for a return to the core teachings of the Gospel and Catholic social teaching.

Shannon's Socials can be found here:
https://linktr.ee/TheFlyingKitchen

Find Mark on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/share/12KTEEYCRWR/?mibextid=wwXIfr

Takeaways
MAGA Catholics harbor significant discontent towards Pope Francis due to his inclusive approach to social issues.
The pro-life movement has evolved into a heretical interpretation of Catholic teaching, focusing narrowly on abortion.
Heresy is defined as a monomania, where one aspect of faith is emphasized to the exclusion of others.
Family and nation are often idolized in conservative Catholic circles, overshadowing the kingdom of God.
Economic policies significantly impact abortion rates, challenging the narrative that solely focuses on legal restrictions.
Media plays a crucial role in shaping Catholic beliefs, often simplifying complex teachings into sound bites.
The Church's stance on war and torture has been compromised by political agendas, particularly among conservative Catholics.
The election of Pope Francis marked a shift towards a more inclusive and socially aware Catholicism, which has faced backlash.
Racial and national identities have become intertwined with religious beliefs, complicating the Church's universal message.
The Church's teachings are intended for all humanity, not just specific tribes or nations. Imposing law as a means of salvation is absurd.
Legalism leads to failure in understanding salvation.
Cruelty and judgment are prevalent in contemporary Christianity.
Evil is a mystery that often defies logic.
Grave evil disguises itself as courage.
Empathy is increasingly labeled as a sin.
A culture of scarcity breeds fear and hostility.
The Great Replacement Theory fuels racism and xenophobia.
The pro-life movement has strayed into moral heresy.
Hope exists in the revolutionary force of Christianity.

episodes.title: Fascism in The Church - Our Experiences Watching Opus Dei and MAGA Infiltrate and Divide
episodes.description:
First Episode of "opus deiNOT GONNA GET AWAY WITH IT" - Exposing the hidden powers behind Project 2025.  Episode 1: From Catholicism to Deconstruction: Michele's Story

In this episode, Shannon Vavich and Michele Quigley delve into the complexities of Project 2025, exploring its implications on democracy and the influence of far-right Catholic ideologies. Michele shares her personal journey from a Methodist upbringing to deep involvement in Catholicism, discussing the impact of strict teachings on family life, contraception, and the challenges faced when questioning authority within the church. The conversation also touches on the political polarization within religious communities and the fallout experienced after leaving the church, highlighting the intersection of faith and fascism in contemporary society. In this conversation, Michele Quigley and Shannon Vavich explore the complexities of motherhood, societal expectations, and the value of women beyond childbearing. They discuss the impact of patriarchy, the importance of religious freedom, and the role of artistic expression in personal healing. The dialogue emphasizes the need for community support, resilience in the face of judgment, and the power of individuality. Through their shared experiences, they highlight the significance of finding joy and beauty in everyday life, encouraging listeners to embrace their unique paths and foster connections with like-minded individuals.
